topComments.author: William Alex Cooper (williamalexcooper)

A vista do topo do √°pice do passeio √© de tirar o f√¥lego, e voc√™ pode at√© ver o horizonte de Nova York a cerca de 80 quil√¥metros de dist√¢ncia se a visibilidade do tempo for suficiente. (Original) This is without a doubt the most intense roller coaster that I have ever ridden! Despite the ride time only lasting 20 seconds, the things that Kingda Ka does to you in that timeframe is a lot. The view from the top of the ride's apex is breathtaking, and you can even see the skyline of NYC some 50 miles away if the weather visibility is sufficient enough. This is a great ride, but I feel like it is too short from start to finish. I also think this ride may be too intense for some people, so only ride this if you feel brave enough or want to experience a quick thrill rush.

topComments.author: Lars Fr√∂lich
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Uma experi√™ncia fora deste mundo. A montanha-russa mais alta do mundo e a mais r√°pida da Am√©rica do Norte: 0 a 206 km/h em 3,5 segundos d√° a voc√™ uma incr√≠vel sensa√ß√£o de acelera√ß√£o, t√£o poderosa que ningu√©m nem grita por causa do choque e do peso pesado em seu peito. √â inst√°vel e um pouco √°spero, mas emocionante e inclui uma queda vertical de saca-rolhas de 90¬∞ de uma altura de 120m (equivalente a um pr√©dio de 40 andares) Mesmo se voc√™ fizer isso apenas uma vez na vida, n√£o poder√° deixar passar a oportunidade se estiver nesta parte dos EUA. Eu pagaria a entrada do parque apenas para esta montanha-russa. Nada se compara a isso.  (Original) An out of this world experience. The world's tallest and north america's fastest rollercoaster: 0 to 206km/h in 3.5 seconds gives you an amazing feeling of acceleration, so powerful no one even screams because of the shock and the heavy weight on your chest. It's shaky and a bit rough but exhilarating and includes a 90¬∞ vertical corkscrew drop from a height of 120m (equivalent of a 40 story building) Even if you go on it only once in your life, you can't pass on the opportunity if you're ever in this part of the US. I would pay park admission for this coaster alone. Nothing compares to it.
